newsitem.title: USA: Progress to buy Apptivity for $13 mln.
newsitem.headline: Progress to buy Apptivity for $13 mln.

text.p: Progress Software said Monday it agreed to buy Apptivity Corp for $13 million in cash and stock.

Apptivity introduced earlier this year the first available tool for building and deploying thin-client, multi-tiered Java business applications. The tool, also called Apptivity, enables developers to build and deploy intranet/extranet business applications, Progress said.

"We are very excited that Apptivity is joining Progress Software," said Purna Pareek, president and founder of Apptivity. "Progress Software's marketing and support base will give us instant worldwide exposure, helping to extend our market presence."
Pareek will be a vice president at Progess, with responsibility for the Apptivity product unit, the company said in a press release.
Progress also said it plans to expand immediately Apptivity's Newark, Calif.-based development and marketing teams with new hires and staff from Progress.
